posts.name: Neal Kotval
posts.cooked:
Our robot is following the auto path but rotates 180 degrees through the path. IF it is a straight line it will go straight but start at 0 and end on 180. Out pathplanner path tells it to just go straight. Here is our code:

Code for the STORM Robotics FRC Team #8849. Contribute to Neal-Kotval/2024StormFRC development by creating an account on GitHub.

link_counts.title: GitHub - Neal-Kotval/2024StormFRC: Code for the STORM Robotics FRC Team #8849

posts.name: Justin Sommer
posts.cooked: Quick question- are you setting a starting pose in the auto path? I know with PathPlanner, if you don’t set a starting pose, some weird things can happen

posts.name: Justin Sommer
posts.cooked: Also, where are the auto paths located in your code? Normally they are in the deploy folder.

posts.name: Neal Kotval
posts.cooked: We did preset the starting pose in path planner with the checkbox. I changed some code in which I accidentally deleted the deploy folder but the same auto we used should be in there now

posts.name: Justin Sommer
posts.cooked: I see you haven’t enabled ReplanningConfig. I would do that in line 72 in Swerve.java by changing new ReplanningConfig() to new ReplanningConfig(true, true) . What this does is it allows the AutoBuilder to correct for error while running the path. I know that when we enabled it, it solved some of our problems with auton.

posts.name: Neal Kotval
posts.cooked: Problem was fixed. Turned out we never tuned the PID in our configureHolonomic function which built the auto
